folder: Orchard Street & Rivington Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
Orchard Street, at, adjoining and south of the S.E. corner of Rivington Street, showing the push cart market, a local feature of this area.

About 1925.

Ewing Galloway.

folder: Rivington Street & Orchard Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
Rivington Street, west from Orchard to Allen Streets, showing a portion of the over-flow of the push cart market on Orchard Street. Buildings appearing on the left are Nos. 83 to 69, of which the farthest two (Nos. 75 and 73-69) have been demolished in the widening of Allen Street. Note on Allen Street, a pillar and stairway of the Second Ave. Elevated Line which has a station at this point.

About 1925.

Ewing Galloway.

passover cakes, for the yiddish public, at corner of Orchard and Rivington Streets.
April 8, 1928.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Occupations - Peddlers - Food - Refreshments - Cakes - Pastry.

folder: Orchard Street & Rivington Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
(1) Orchard Street, east side, north from but not including Rivington, to and including East Houston Streets. The view shows the pushcart peddler's market on Orchard Street.

May 5, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, slightly northward.

May 5, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

(3) The same, as seen from the N.E. corner of Rivington Street.

January 20, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: Rivington Street & Orchard Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
Rivington Street, north side, east from but not including Orchard, to and including Ludlow Streets.

April 28, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

A pushcart vendor (Macaroons); one of the many such sellers of food and merchandise that throng this thriving east-side, Orchard Street mart. This individual is on Orchard Street, at the N.E. corner of Rivington Street.

March 26, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Occupations - Peddlers - Food - Cake.

text:
Peddlers--foodstuffs and clothing: The Orchard Street push-cart market viewed northwestward toward Rivington Street (right).

1937-8

Alexander Alland
title: Occupations - Peddlers - Foodstuffs and Clothing.
